means: 古希腊的银币名，古希腊的重量单位

sentence.Network_en: In April 1992 the Greek drachma was the only Community currency not yet part of the EMS exchange-rate mechanism.
sentence.Network_cn: 1992年4月间希腊的德拉克马是唯一一种还未纳入欧洲货币体系兑换机制的欧共体成员国货币。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 希腊的德拉克马（Drachma）是古希腊银币的名称，出现在公元前7世纪的古希腊，被称为是世界上最古老的流通货币。从1833年起， …

古希腊人铸造了德拉马克(drachma)银币，含银量为1/8盎司。在罗马，基本的钱币为迪纳里厄斯(denarius)银币，重1/7盎司。

a number who had practiced sorcery brought theirscrolls together and burned them publicly . when they calculated scrolls , the total came to fifty thousand drachmas .平素行邪术的、也有许多人把书拿来、堆积在众人面前焚烧．他们算计书价、便知道共合五万块钱。

derivation.yuyuan_name: via Latin from Greek drakhmē, an Attic weight and coin. Compare with dirham and drachm

entry.tran: 德拉克马(希腊货币单位，现被欧元所代替)
entry.def: The drachma was the unit of money used in Greece before it was replaced by the euro.

means.word_mean: 1. a unit of apothecary weight equal to an eighth of an ounce or to 60 grains
2. formerly the basic unit of money in Greece
